private_information: I observe a set of action schemas named paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted with object arities as described in the environment.

I have the first problem statement initial facts and the proposed plan consisting of clip object_9 object_3 object_5, clip object_10 object_3 object_5, wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1, tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_6, tightfisted object_10 object_3 object_6.
player_a.goal: Achieve next object_10 object_6 and next object_9 object_6 for the first scenario.

private_information: I observe the same action schema set and I have the second problem statement initial facts and the target next object_10 object_7 and next object_11 object_8.
I can produce a grounded interpretation of actions relative to the objects appearing in the second statement.
player_b.goal: Achieve next object_10 object_7 and next object_11 object_8 for the second scenario.

private_information: I specialize in auditing temporal and causal consistency and removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and ad hoc post-hoc penalties.
I will inspect partial models and plans for hidden assumptions, implicit token usage, and temporal ordering errors.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that identifies causal gaps, naming mismatches, and recommended canonicalizations to make models and plans temporally and causally sound.

private_information: I receive grounded models from players and the auditor report and must integrate them into a single PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problems for FastDownward.
I will keep agent actions distinct and resolve naming mismatches and typing gaps found by the auditor.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem files compatible with the FastDownward solver that achieve the requested goals while preserving distinct agent actions.

public_information: Objects are tokens named object_0 through object_11 and beyond as referenced.

Action paltry takes three object parameters and requires facts hand, cats, texture, a vase relation between two objects, and a next relation; paltry adds next between two objects and deletes the vase relation.
Action sip takes three object parameters and requires hand, cats, texture, and two next relations; sip adds a vase relation and deletes one next relation.
Action clip takes three object parameters and requires hand, sneeze, texture, and two next relations; clip adds a vase relation and deletes one next relation.

Action wretched takes four object parameters and requires sneeze, two texture facts, stupendous, a next relation, and collect relations; wretched adds a next relation and deletes another next relation.
Action memory takes three object parameters and requires cats and two spring facts and a next relation; memory adds a next relation and deletes another next relation.
Action tightfisted takes three object parameters and requires hand, sneeze, texture, a next relation, and a vase relation; tightfisted adds a next relation and deletes the vase relation.
The domain contains binary relations next, vase, collect, and unary predicates hand, cats, sneeze, spring, stupendous and texture applied to objects.

Two separate scenario statements exist. Each scenario provides a set of initial ground facts and a goal expressed as next relations between specific objects. Players hold different scenario facts and plans.

model.system_prompt: You are an agent that constructs a grounded, explicit action model and object mapping from observed action descriptions and an initial statement. Produce a precise logical description of action preconditions, add effects, and delete effects using explicit predicate names and object tokens. Do not emit PDDL. Mark any assumptions you make and identify objects that appear in the provided plan.
model.prompt: Your name is player_a. Use the public information and your private facts and plan to deliver a compact, unambiguous action model and an object mapping for the first scenario. Do not output PDDL. Focus on explicit preconditions and effects and on any naming or typing ambiguities that must be resolved.

model.system_prompt: You are an agent that constructs a grounded, explicit action model and object mapping from observed action descriptions and an initial statement. Produce a precise logical description of action preconditions, add effects, and delete effects using explicit predicate names and object tokens. Do not emit PDDL. Mark any assumptions you make and identify objects that appear in the provided plan.
model.prompt: Your name is player_b. Use the public information and your private facts to deliver a compact, unambiguous action model and an object mapping for the second scenario. Do not output PDDL. Focus on explicit preconditions and effects and on any naming or typing ambiguities that must be resolved.

audit.system_prompt: You are an expert auditor of temporal and causal consistency. Inspect the provided grounded models and report any causal gaps, temporal ordering issues, naming mismatches between tokens, and any bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties. Provide concrete recommendations and normalized token mappings for the orchestrator to apply. Do not output PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You receive the models from player_a and player_b. Produce an audit report that lists conflicts, missing causal links, temporal ordering problems, and suggested canonicalizations to remove bookkeeping shortcuts. Provide explicit resolution suggestions that the orchestrator can apply.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and in producing PDDL domain and problem files tailored for the FastDownward solver. Integrate the grounded models and the auditor report, resolve naming and typing mismatches, preserve distinct agent actions by prefixing or otherwise keeping actions attributable to each agent, and produce a single PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files. The resulting PDDL must be compatible with FastDownward STRIPS and ADL features where justified. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure objects, predicates, types, and all referenced facts are consistent and that goals from the agents are encoded.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Use the public information, the two models, and the audit report to generate a coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting FastDownward that implements the intended actions and achieves the goals specified by the agents. Keep agent actions distinct and resolve any audit-identified issues. Output the domain and problem using the required enclosure tags.
